decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana advantage by bouncing multiple artifacts back to hand. By efficiently cycling through artifacts and generating mana, the deck aims to set up a winning combo or outvalue the opponent with powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and flexibility for the deck's strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to leverage artifacts and card draw to create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using efficient removal and countermagic to control the board while drawing cards and disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mix of powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Time Walk, along with key artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for ramp, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to cast small creatures from the graveyard, adding another layer of resilience and card advantage to the strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug in order to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid. Force of Negation and Force of Will help protect the combo pieces while cards like Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul provide additional value. Bazaar of Baghdad is crucial for both filling the graveyard and digging for combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a strong graveyard presence and fast-paced gameplay.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using artifacts like Moxen, Mana Crypt, and Grim Monolith, allowing for fast plays and big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle to control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful artifacts and lock down their strategies through disruption, while also having the ability to generate card advantage with Mystic Forge and Sensei's Divining Top.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing powerful spells and counters to disrupt opponents while also generating card advantage through draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck focuses on efficient removal with Swords to Plowshares and counters like Force of Will and Force of Negation. It also includes disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Orcish Bowmasters to further hinder opponent strategies. With access to powerful mana acceleration like Black Lotus and Moxen, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent by playing hatebears that stifle their ability to play spells efficiently, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to limit the opponent's options, while also playing disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Void Mirror. The deck aims to control the game through a combination of hate effects and aggressive creatures to overpower the opponent and secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts. By utilizing mana ramping artifacts like Moxen, Sol Ring, and Grim Monolith, this deck aims to quickly play out threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler to put pressure on the opponent. With cards like Mystic Forge and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, the deck can generate card advantage and maintain a strong board state. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and ramp by bouncing artifacts back to hand. It also includes cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces, like Moxen and Tolarian Academy, to generate large amounts of mana and draw cards. It also includes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to further enhance its advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while setting up for a powerful combo finish.

The deck focuses on utilizing card advantage, disruption, and powerful control elements to dominate and outpace the opponent. By using cards like Hullbreacher, Mana Drain, and Force of Will, it aims to counter and control the opponent's gameplay while generating value with Stock Up and Yawgmoth's Will. The inclusion of powerful cards like Tinker and Bolas's Citadel provide win conditions and game-ending threats. With a strong mana base and access to powerful artifacts, the deck aims to establish control early on and maintain dominance throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana efficiency while setting up a combo win condition. By combining cheap artifacts and powerful draw spells with creatures like Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to quickly assemble a lethal board state or combo out with Time Vault. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional recursion and versatility to ensure resilience against disruption while maintaining a fast, proactive game plan. The deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble lethal threats and overwhelm opponents in the early game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while assembling key combo pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key to take extra turns. It includes efficient interaction and card advantage spells to control the game and find the necessary combo pieces to win. The deck utilizes powerful artifacts and spells to generate mana and card advantage, allowing the player to stay ahead of the opponent and dictate the pace of the game. In addition, it has access to disruptive creatures like Hullbreacher to further disrupt the opponent's plans and protect its own win conditions.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful combo using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Stock Up to draw through the deck, generating mana with artifacts like Moxen and Tolarian Academy, and then either winning with a powerful spell like Time Walk or a creature like Thundertrap Trainer. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds consistency to the strategy by allowing certain cards to be recast from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to execute its combo quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana resources using artifact accelerants like Moxen and Mana Crypt, as well as land like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb. It utilizes powerful artifact creatures and artifacts like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Mystic Forge allow for card advantage and efficient gameplay. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana production and powerful artifact threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with hatebears and aggro creatures while utilizing cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Archon of Emeria to slow down their game plan. By effectively controlling the board and using cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Seasoned Dungeoneer to pressure the opponent, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent quickly. It also has some mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to ramp into its threats faster. The key strategy is to be proactive in disrupting the opponent while applying pressure to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements such as Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Gifts Ungiven to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a win condition. It leverages cards like Underworld Breach and Lrien Revealed for recursion and card advantage, and includes a package of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for fast mana acceleration. By effectively managing resources and controlling the game's pace, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with artifacts and mana acceleration to play powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. It utilizes cards like Mystic Forge and Sensei's Divining Top for card advantage and control, while also including disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a mana denial strategy with cards like Mishra's Workshop and City of Traitors, allowing it to pressure opponents and close out games quickly with aggressive threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler.
